answers.answer: I never had my water broken. It broke while I gave birth so you will be ok either way. There is no medical reason to break your water. Good luck mama. I hope everything goes great for you.
I'm in Australia, had my first at 37 weeks and my waters didn't break on their own, so the doctor broke them for me. I didn't ask him to either.

question: I just got back from my weekly non-stress test  (weekly because of gestational diabetes). I am having regular contractions and have been for a few hours. They are about 3 1/2-4 1/2 minutes apart! Yesterday I was 4 cm dilated and 80% effaced. I am 37 weeks 5 days. My doctor aloud me to leave the hospital so that I could get my son off to the babysitters. I will be going back to the hospital, most likely tonight.  My question is, doctors cannot break your waters before 39 weeks. Well since I am before 39 weeks, do I have to wait until it breaks on its own?  I mean, what happens when I am 10 cm and 100% effaced and the water is still intact? They have to break it then, don't they????
title: It may be time
